intro: Gagea dutoitii, commonly known as the Dutoit's gagea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Liliaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces underground bulbs that store nutrients. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
